pattern.name: Time from peak
pattern.description:
Elapsed time from the moment, when a numerical attribute reached its maximum/minimum value. In the case of a tie, time from the most recent maximum/minimum is returned.
Note: NumericalColumn can be null and that can cause ties -> avoid nulls. However, ties can still happen -> pick the most recent (the maximum) time value (note that it also deals with ties at timeColumn level).
pattern.example: How long ago did the customer transfer the biggest amount.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , DATEDIFF(@baseDate, max(@timeColumn)) AS @columnName FROM (SELECT @base , @timeColumn , RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY @basePartitionBy ORDER BY @numericalColumn @sortOrder) AS rk FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @numericalColumn IS NOT NULL ) t WHERE rk = 1 GROUP BY @base
